titleStmt.title: The loue and complayntes bytwene Mars and Venus
titleStmt.author: Chaucer, Geoffrey, d. 1400.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A18555 of text S106471 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 5089). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 33 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 15 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Images scanned from microfilm: (Early English books, 1475-1640 ; 879:01)

titleStmt.title: The loue and complayntes bytwene Mars and Venus
titleStmt.author: Chaucer, Geoffrey, d. 1400.

notesStmt.note: Includes: "The campleynt. of Mars", "The compleynt of Venus for Mars", and "The cou[n]ceyll of Chaucer touchyng maryag [et] c. whiche was sente te [sic] Bucketon [et] c.", all by Geoffrey Chaucer; and "The fyrst fynders of the vii. scyences artyficyall", an unidentified text.
Colophon reads: Thys in pryntyde in westmoster inkyng. strete. For me Iulianus Notarii [all sic].
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
